ul.li1: 1“Ho! Everyone thirsty, come to the waters!
ul.li2: And whoever has no money, come, buy and eat,
ul.li1: and come, buy without money,
ul.li2: wine and milk without price!
ul.li1: 2Why do you weigh out money for what is not food,
ul.li2: and your labor for what cannot satisfy?Literally “what is not for satiation”
ul.li1: Listen carefully to me, and eat what is good,
ul.li2: and let your soul take pleasure in richLiterally “fatty” food.
ul.li1: 3Extend your ear, and come to me!
ul.li2: Listen so thatOr “and” your soul may live,
ul.li1: and I will makeLiterally “cut” an everlasting covenant withor “for” you,
ul.li2: the enduring proofs of the mercies shown toLiterally “mercy of” David.
ul.li1: 4Look! I madeOr “gave” him a witness to the peoples,
ul.li2: a leader and a commander for the peoples.
ul.li1: 5Look! You shall call a nation that you do not know,
ul.li2: and a nation that does not know you shall run to you,
ul.li1: because of Yahweh your God,
ul.li2: and the holy one of Israel, for he has glorified you.”
ul.li1: 6Seek Yahweh while he lets himself be found;Literally “in his letting himself be found”
ul.li2: call him while he isLiterally “in his being” near.
ul.li1: 7Let the wicked forsake his way,
ul.li2: and the man of sin his thoughts.
ul.li1: And let him return to Yahweh, thatOr “and” he may take pity on him,
ul.li2: and to our God, for he will forgive manifold.Literally “make numerous to”
ul.li1: 8“For my thoughts are not your thoughts,
ul.li2: and your ways are not my ways,”

ul.li1: 9“For as the heavens are higherLiterally “high” than the earth,
ul.li2: so my ways are higherLiterally “high” than your ways,
and my thoughts than your thoughts.
ul.li1: 10For just as the rain and the snow come down from heaven,
ul.li2: and they do not return there
ul.li1: except they have watered the earth thoroughly
ul.li2: and cause it to bring forth and sprout,
ul.li1: and give seed to the sower
ul.li2: and bread to the eater,
ul.li1: 11so shall be my word that goes out from my mouth.
ul.li2: It shall not return to me without success,
ul.li1: but shall accomplishOr “do” what I desire
ul.li2: and be successful in the thing for which I sent it.
ul.li1: 12For you shall go out in joy,
ul.li2: and you shall be led in peace.
ul.li1: The mountains and the hills shall break forth before you, rejoicing
ul.li2: and all the trees of the field shall clap hands.Hebrew “hand”
ul.li1: 13Instead of the thorn bush, the juniper shall go up;
ul.li2: instead of the brier, the myrtle shall go up,
ul.li1: and it shall serve as a memorial to Yahweh,
ul.li2: for an everlasting sign that shall not be cut off.”
